item.title: Report E-2025020091
item.description:
Report E-2025020091

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum was punctured and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of methanol product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha Omega Training & Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized cleaning agent, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010204
item.description:
Report E-2025010204

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: SEABOARD MARINE, LTD., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 34769
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Container SMLU 794269-2 containing UN3109 Organic Peroxide Type F, Liquid, Class 5.2 was reported leaking onboard M/V Seaboard Gemini on its way from Savanah to KGT. A decision was made to divert the ship to Miami to address the situation. Cliff Berry Inc. was called for the spill cleanup. Incident reported to NRC; report number 1419124.

item.title: Report E-2025020089
item.description:
Report E-2025020089

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-02
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS AIR CARGO MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY DURING SCREENING PROCESS OF WHITE COURIER BAGS GOING TO COLOMBIA UNDECLARED FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS WERE FOUND. THERE ARE TWO BOXES INSIDE THE WHITE COURIER BAG WITH LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS ON THE CONCEALED FIBERBOARD BOXES. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS NUMEROUS ASSORTED FLAMMABLE CONSUMER PRODUCTS INSIDE EACH BOX. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER WHITE COURIER BAG.

item.title: Report E-2025020067
item.description:
Report E-2025020067

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SCREENING PROCESS OF A PREBUILT UNIT (PBU) AAD99838UPS OFFERED TO UPS AIR CARGO SERVICES IN MIAMI, FLORIDA GOING TO COLOMBIA WE FOUND ONE BOX WITH A MOSTLY REMOVED BATTERY MARK. CONTENT INSPECTION INSIDE THE BOX REVEALS BICYCLE PARTS WITH ONE WAHOO GPS TYPE DEVICE CONTAINING AN INSTALLED LITHIUM-ION BATTERY AND ONE LOOSE LITHIUM-ION RECHARGEABLE BATTERY THAT IS PACKED WITH THE EQUIPMENT. AN INVESTIGATION WITH THE SHIPPER IS ONGOING.
